text:
I always knew I wanted to work in a scientific field.
 Science is a domain that has attracted me since I was a child, and that was amplified by the reading of books and magazines, and by watching movies.
 During the years before High School, I was still hesitating on the specific domain that I wanted to work in, but all of this hesitation has suddenly stopped when I made the 3è (the last year before HS) observation internship in my father's company.  This event  has played a key role in my orientation, giving me the will to work with computers, in order to create amazing objects and giving the possibility to reach new horizons. In other words : it made me dream.
 While reading theses lines,  I think you've guessed : I was in an IT company.
 The internship lasted three days only,  but they were sufficient to convince me !
 We were 3 school boys from different places, and  we had a full schedule, with no time to rest. In deed, each 2 hours, we had a meeting with a specialist that was working in the company, in a specific field. Almost all of them were engineers or researchers in computer science, but each of them was working in a whole new  domain. This diversity of subjects made me realize that with studies in computer science, I would never get bored, as there are things to discover and handle every day (IT is changing really fast, with the apparition of new technologies and concepts all the time).
 Since that moment, my vision has obviously changed and sharpened, but the spark that it created in my mind never blew off, quite the contrary.
 Still, at the end of  High School, when I had to decide where I was going the years after (what studies I would do), I had little apprehension about the fact that I would like to work in computer science.
 Despite everything, I had only OBSERVED and not practiced, so there was a chance that I would appreciate new technologies from a user perspective, but not as a developer.
 Hopefully, some month after I was starting my IT license, and the courses were amazing and very interesting : I had made the good decision.
